description: Jamie Oliver is a British chef and television personality. He is known for his focus on healthy eating and sustainable food practices. He has written numerous cookbooks and hosted several television shows, including The Naked Chef and Jamie Oliver's Food Revolution.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Season the beef with garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Rub with olive oil and roast for 1 hour until cooked to desired doneness.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Cook pancetta in a skillet until crispy. Whisk together egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, and heavy cream. Drain spaghetti, add to skillet with pancetta, and toss with egg mixture until creamy.

Heat oil in a saucepan, add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add curry powder and mixed vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. Add vegetable broth and simmer for 20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Pierce potatoes with a fork and bake for 1 hour until tender. Cut open, top with butter, sour cream, chives, salt, and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Stir in eggs, buttermilk, and melted butter until smooth. Pour into a greased cake pan and bake for 35-40 minutes

description: Ina Garten is an American chef, author, and television personality. She is best known for her show Barefoot Contessa and her cookbooks, which focus on simple and elegant recipes that can be made at home.

recipes.cooking_method: Peel and dice butternut squash. Heat oil in a saucepan, add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add Arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken broth one cup at a time, stirring until absorbed before adding more. Add butternut squash and continue cooking until rice is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Stir in eggs, buttermilk, and melted butter until smooth. Pour into a greased cake pan and bake for 35-40 minutes

description: Gordon Ramsay is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his fiery personality and his focus on using high-quality ingredients in his cooking.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Season the beef with garlic.

Heat oil in a saucepan, add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add curry powder and mixed vegetables and cook for 5 minutes. Add vegetable broth and simmer for 20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Preheat oven to 425°F. Rub chicken with lemon, olive oil, garlic, and thyme.

description: Nigella Lawson is a British food writer, chef, and television personality. She is known for her indulgent recipes and her relaxed approach to cooking.

recipes.cooking_method: Indulgent recipes and her relaxed approach to cooking.
Preheat oven to 425°F. Rub chicken with lemon, olive oil, garlic, and thyme.

description: Ellivs Tork is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is known for his fiery temper, his high standards for cooking, and his Michelin-starred restaurants.

recipes.cooking_method: Season the beef with salt and pepper. Sear the beef on all sides until browned. Blend mushrooms and onions until they become a paste. Spread the mixture over the beef. Wrap the beef with puff pastry and bake at 425°F for 30-40 minutes.
Preheat oven to 425°F. Rub chicken with lemon, olive oil, garlic, and thyme. Roast for 60-70 minutes until the chicken is golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 165°F.

Preheat oven to 325°F. Whisk egg yolks and sugar together. Heat cream and vanilla extract until almost boiling. Slowly pour cream into egg mixture while whisking constantly. Pour mixture into ramekins and bake for 35-40 minutes. Chill for at least 2 hours. Sprinkle brown sugar on top and caramelize with a torch.

Preheat oven to 325°F. Whisk egg yolks and sugar together. Heat cream and vanilla extract until almost boiling. Slowly pour cream into egg mixture while whisking constantly. Pour mixture into ramekins and bake for 35-40 minutes. Chill for at least 2 hours. Sprinkle brown sugar on top and caramelize with a torch.
